resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
nealrichardson commented on pull request #4727: ARROW-5415: [Release] Release script should update R version everywhere
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4727
 
 
   Note: this PR is based on https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4711. I'll rebase once that merges, but I wanted to put this up for review sooner. The relevant change for this patch is https://github.com/apache/arrow/commit/b8963d38b4e599909c119378155fe702e6b76b11; all changes outside of the `dev/` directory belong to #4711.
   
   In previous patches, I removed other places where the version was explicitly referenced, making them parse it from `r/DESCRIPTION` where necessary. The only remaining one (added by #4711) is `r/NEWS.md`, and it works a little differently when bumping from a release version to a dev version. So from dev to release, we go from e.g. 
   
   ```
   # arrow 0.13.0.9000
   
   * Stuff we did in this release
   * More stuff
   ```
   
   to
   
   ```
   # arrow 0.14.0
   
   * Stuff we did in this release
   * More stuff
   ```
   
   but when bumping after release for the next dev version, it goes to
   
   ```
   # arrow 0.14.0.9000
   
   # arrow 0.14.0
   
   * Stuff we did in this release
   * More stuff
   ```
   
   so that we have a place to accumulate the list of changes in the next release.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org
